answers.text: more power than is permitted by the specifications for a single port.

qas.question: Some devices such as an external hard and optical disk drive can use what?
What is another alternative for power for an external hard and optical disk drive?
What is the purpose of a dual-input USB cable?

answers.text: one input of which is used for power and data transfer, the other solely for power

context: Some USB devices require <a0_0>more power than is permitted by the specifications for a single port.<a0_0/> This is common for external hard and optical disc drives, and generally for devices with motors or lamps. Such devices can use <a1_0>an external power supply<a1_0/>, which is allowed by the standard, or use <a2_0>a dual-input USB cable<a2_0/>, <a3_0>one input of which is used for power and data transfer, the other solely for power<a3_0/>, which makes the device a non-standard USB device. Some USB ports and external hubs can, in practice, supply more power to USB devices than required by the specification but a standard-compliant device may not depend on this.
